thread.title: Don’t reduce benefits for current retirees

author: John Woodrow Cox
title: Don’t reduce benefits for current retirees
text:
October 15 at 5:16 PM In his Oct. 12 op-ed, “ A fairer approach to fiscal reform ,” Douglas Elmendorf, former director of the Congressional Budget Office, appeared to favor increasing taxes and reducing benefits for higher- income recipients of Social Security and Medicare benefits. Reducing benefits or raising premiums for those now retired, regardless of income, is inherently unfair.
This strategy also imposes additional uncertainty for those nearing retirement and engaged in retirement planning. Any efforts to maintain the solvency of these systems should remain focused on pre­retirement modifications such as increasing the retirement age and the level of income subject to Social Security and Medicare taxes. And changes to these systems should not be used as a covert means of wealth redistribution.
Donald J. DeNucci , North Potomac
